description: Surrogate numeric identifier for each configuration entry. Used as the primary key to uniquely reference a setting.
Canonical key for the configuration setting used by the application to look up its value. Must be unique within this table.
Expected data type of the setting’s value (e.g., string or integer). Guides validation, parsing, and UI rendering.
Human-readable explanation of what the configuration controls and how it’s used. Aids administrators when managing settings.
Current configured value for the setting referenced by the key. Consumed at runtime; may contain sensitive data depending on the setting.
Flag indicating whether the setting can be exposed to client-side code or user interfaces. False implies server-only use.
Flag marking the value as a secret credential. Such values should be encrypted, masked in logs/UI, and restricted in access.
